page.title: 05MOTOR VEHICLES
page.content: The engine provides the power to turn the car wheels. Most cars have their engines in the front. But some cars have the engine at the back. The engine power comes from burning a mixture of petrol and air in closed spaces called cylinders. Most car engines have four or six cylinders in a straight line, some are in the shape of a V. Inside each cylinder is a piston rather like an upturned barrel which can move up and down. A gas is produced by the burning fuel to push the piston. The pistons are connected to the crank shaft and force it round. From the crank shaft the turning motion is carried to the driving wheels by the transmition system.This is how an engine works.
